availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Nathaniel L. Lightfoot (Hancock County, KY, farmer, physician, HC State Guard)

body.p: Hancock County, Kentucky, farmer, physician, and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Ema P Lightfoot. Father of E. W. Lightfoot, Annie W Lightfoot, and Alma Lightfoot. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Breckinridge County in 1847. Farmer in Hancock County in 1860. Served in the Hancock County Home Guard in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, District No 2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 12.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Lams Voting District, p. 76.
Lewis Collins and Richard Collins, Collins' Historical Sketches of Kentucky (Louisville: Richard H. Collins, 1877), 772.
